0                                           54958+*     Multicast Source Filter Structures from RFC 3678                *
                                            54959+*                                                                     *
                                            54960+*   *** These require the inclusion of BPXYSOCK ***                   *
                                            54961+*----------------------------------------------------------------- @DMA
                                            54962+*                                                                  @DMA
                                            54963+***********************************************************************
                                            54964+* SIOCGRTTABLE - Obtain route information. Returns information for    *
                                            54965+*                IPv4 routes from the TCP/IP stack's main route table.*
                                            54966+*                                                                     *
                                            54967+*                The Route entry structures returned can either be    *
                                            54968+*                Version 1, Version 2, or Version 3 structures.       *
                                            54969+*                  Version 1                                          *
                                            54970+*                    - Field IOCN_IPADDRRTMSGHOMEIF contains an IP    *
                                            54971+*                      address                                        *
                                            54972+*                  Version 2                                          *
                                            54973+*                    - IOCN_RTMSGTYPE structure is the same size      *
                                            54974+*                      as Version 1                                   *
                                            54975+*                    - Field IOCN_IPADDRRTMSGHOMEIF contains an       *
                                            54976+*                      interface index.                               *
                                            54977+*                  Version 3                                          *
                                            54978+*                    - IOCN_RTMSGTYPE structure is larger than the    *
                                            54979+*                      Version 1 or 2 size                            *
                                            54980+*                    - Field IOCN_IPADDRRTMSGHOMEIF contains an       *
                                            54981+*                      interface index                                *
                                            54982+*                    - New MTU field added                            *
                                            54983+*                The RTEV3 macro variable controls whether the        *
                                            54984+*                Version 3 Route entry structure is generated by      *
                                            54985+*                this macro.  By default, the macro generates the     *
                                            54986+*                Version 3 Route entry structure.                     *
                                            54987+*                                                                     *
                                            54988+*                When requesting Version 2 or Version 3 output in a   *
                                            54989+*                CINET environment, invoking applications must either *
                                            54990+*                have stack affinity or use the IOCC#DIRIOCTL to      *
                                            54991+*                invoke this ioctl.  Otherwise, the output from the   *
                                            54992+*                first stack will be in the requested version format  *
                                            54993+*                but, the output from subsequent stacks will be in    *
                                            54994+*                Version 1 format.                                    *
                                            54995+*                                                                     *
                                            54996+* Input     - Input to the ioctl is a buffer length and a buffer      *
                                            54997+*             address.  By default, Version 1 Route entry structures  *
                                            54998+*             are returned.                                           *
                                            54999+*                                                                     *
                                            55000+*             To obtain Version 2 or 3 Route entry output, an         *
                                            55001+*             IOCN_RTMSGHDRTYPE structure must be setup at the        *
                                            55002+*             beginning of the output buffer, before invoking the     *
                                            55003+*             ioctl.  The following fields must be set:               *
                                            55004+*               - IOCN_RTMSGHDRVER set to Version 2 or 3              *
                                            55005+*               - IOCN_RTMSGHDREYEID set to the correct eyecatcher    *
                                            55006+*                 value.                                              *
                                            55007+*                                                                     *

                                            57283+*                                                                     *
                                            57284+*                                                                     *
                                            57285+*      Subtype 1 - BMF totals section for analysis of overall BMF     *
                                            57286+*                  performance.  One storage class summary section    *
                                            57287+*                  for each storage class.                            *
                                            57288+*                                                                     *
                                            57289+*      Subtype 2 - One section for each cache control unit (3990-3)   *
                                            57290+*                  having at least one SMS managed device attached.   *

                                            57292+*                  to a 3990-3 control unit.                          *
                                            57293+*                                                                     *

                                            66597+*/*           For SMF Records 78 and 89 additional switches          */

                                            68539+*01* Macro Name: ERBSMF70                                            *
                                            68540+*                                                                    *
                                            68541+*01* Descriptive Name:  SMF record 70 subtype 1 and 2                *
                                            68542+*02* Acronym: SMF70                                                  *
                                            68543+*                                                                    *
                                            68544+*01* DSECT Name:                                                     *
                                            68545+*02* Subtype 1: SMF70HDR SMF70PRO SMF70CTL SMF70CPU                  *
                                            68546+*02*            SMF70AID SMF70BCT SMF70BPD SMF70CIS                  *
                                            68547+*02* Subtype 2: SMF70HDR SMF70PRO R702TYP3 R702TYP4                  *
                                            68548+*               R702CCF                                              *
                                            68549+*                                                                    *
                                            68550+*01* Component: Resource Measurement Facility (27404)                *
                                            68551+*                                                                    *
                                            68552+*01* Eye-Catcher: None                                               *
                                            68553+*02*  Offset: N/A                                                    *
                                            68554+*02*  Length: N/A                                                    *
                                            68555+*                                                                    *
                                            68556+*01* Storage Attributes:                                             *
                                            68557+*02*   Subpool: 1                                                    *
                                            68558+*02*   Key: 0                                                        *
                                            68559+*02*   Residency: Any                                                *
                                            68560+*02*   Main Storage: N/A                                             *
                                            68561+*02*   Auxiliary Storage: N/A                                        *
                                            68562+*02*   Virtual Storage: N/A                                          *
                                            68563+*                                                                    *
                                            68564+*01* Function = This macro maps the complete SMF record type 70.     *
                                            68565+*                                                                    *
                                            68566+*              It has two subtypes:                                  *
                                            68567+*                                                                    *
                                            68568+*              - Subtype 1 is created by RMF if CPU activity         *
                                            68569+*                measurements are activated.                         *
                                            68570+*              - Subtype 2 is created by RMF if Crypto activity      *
                                            68571+*                measurements are activated.                         *
                                            68572+*                                                                    *
                                            68573+*              The record consists of 4 parts:                       *
                                            68574+*                                                                    *
                                            68575+*              1. The fixed portion of the SMF header.               *
                                            68576+*                 This mapping is invoked by calling ERBHDR macro.   *
                                            68577+*              2. The individual header extension which contains     *
                                            68578+*                 offset/length/number triplets to address the       *
                                            68579+*                 record parts following the RMF product section.    *
                                            68580+*              3. The RMF product section.                           *
                                            68581+*                 This mapping is invoked by calling ERBPRO macro.   *
                                            68582+*              4. The RMF data sections                              *
                                            68583+*                                                                    *
                                            68584+*01* Notes: None                                                     *
                                            68585+*                                                                    *
                                            68586+*01* Size:                                                           *
                                            68587+*                                                                    *
                                            68588+*    Subtype 1:                                                      *
                                            68589+*                                                                    *
                                            68590+*    - Common Header . . . . . . . . . :  36 bytes                   *
                                            68591+*    - Header Extension  . . . . . . . :  40 bytes                   *
                                            68592+*    - Product Section . . . . . . . . :  60 bytes                   *

0                                           69854+*    Optionally, the parameter area can point to a symbol table
                                            69855+*    (SYMBT) which consists of the SYMBT header plus SYMBTE entries

                                            69858+*
                                            69859+*02* Return information is provided in the fullword pointed to by
                                            69860+*    field SymbpReturnCode@. Possible values are:
                                            69861+*03* 0
                                            69862+*03*    Meaning: Successful Completion. All requested substitution
                                            69863+*                was performed.
                                            69864+*03*    Action:  None required.
                                            69865+*
                                            69866+*03* 4
                                            69867+*03*    Meaning: Warning. When Substring was specified, a substring
                                            69868+*                that exceeded the bounds of the substitution text,
                                            69869+*                or a substring in which the length was specified
                                            69870+*                as 0, was found.
                                            69871+*                Substitution continues.
                                            69872+*03*    Action:  None required.
                                            69873+*
                                            69874+*03* 8
                                            69875+*03*    Meaning: Warning. Target buffer was too small to contain
                                            69876+*                all of the substitution text.
                                            69877+*03*    Action:  Specify a larger target buffer, or continue
                                            69878+*                processing using the value returned in the fullword
                                            69879+*                pointed to by field SymbpTargetLength@ to determine
                                            69880+*                how much data was placed into the target buffer.
                                            69881+*
                                            69882+*03* 12
                                            69883+*03*    Meaning: Error. When CheckNull was specified, a substitution
                                            69884+*                text length of 0 was encountered when performing
                                            69885+*                substitution. Substitution continues.
                                            69886+*03*    Action:  None required. The system informs the program of the
                                            69887+*                situation in which it was interested. It is up to
                                            69888+*                the program to determine the necessary course of
                                            69889+*                action.
                                            69890+*
                                            69891+*03* 16
                                            69892+*03*    Meaning: Warning. When WarnNoSub was specified, the
                                            69893+*                substitution process encountered no symbols for
                                            69894+*                which to substitute.
                                            69895+*                The substitution processing completed normally.
                                            69896+*03*    Action:  None required.

            34 | JOBENV::JOBENV(char * argv0)

            38 |   psa    *  psaP    = (psa *)NULL;
            39 |   tcbfix *  tcbfixP = (tcbfix*)psaP->psatold;
            40 |             tcbfixP = (tcbfix*)((char *)tcbfixP-sizeof(tcbfixP->tcbfrs));
            41 |   tiot1ds *  tiot1P  = (tiot1ds*)tcbfixP->tcbtio;

            45 |
            46 | 	rbprfx * rbprfxP = (rbprfx *)tcbfixP->tcbrbp;
            47 | 	rbprfxP        = (rbprfx *)((char *)rbprfxP -64); //RB prefix 64 bytes
            48 | 	int ok = 1;
            49 | 	while (ok&&(rbprfxP->xstab1&rbftp))
            50 | 		ä
            51 | 		  if (rbprfxP->xstab2&rbtcbnxt)
            52 | 				ok = 0;
            53 | 			rbprfxP = (rbprfx *)(rbprfxP->xrblnka);
            54 | 			rbprfxP = (rbprfx *)((char *)rbprfxP -64); //RB prefix 64 bytes
            55 | 		ü
            56 | 	if (ok)
            57 | 		ä
            58 | 		 cdentry * cdentryP = (cdentry *)(rbprfxP->rbcde1);
            59 | 		 programRb = mvsSTRING((char *)cdentryP->cdname,8);
            60 | 		ü
            61 | 	else
            62 | 		programRb = "";
            63 |
            64 |   jobName        = mvsSTRING((char *)tiot1P->tiocnjob,8);
            65 |   stepName       = mvsSTRING((char *)tiot1P->tiocpstn,8);
            66 |   procStepName   = mvsSTRING((char *)tiot1P->tiocpstn,8);
            67 |   jobId          = mvsSTRING((char *)ssibP->ssibjbid,8);
            68 |
            69 |   jobName.strip();
            70 |   jobId.strip();
            71 |   stepName.strip();
            72 |   procStepName.strip();
            73 |   program.strip();
            74 |
            75 |   if (getenv(KEYWORD_DEBUG))

            77 |   else
            78 |     debug = 0;
